resource.chars:
All wrong
<s>Note The equation between the three standards was de[rived?]
from 20 observations The average error (that is the [sum?] 
of all the errors from the mean value divided by the nu[mber] 
of observations was 
.54 in (24) 1.22 in (44) and 1.15 in (68) 
In order to determine whether the eye is more sensi[tive] 
to variations in brightness or to variations in colour 
I have determined also the average error in the sum of the three 
and also that of their differences 
Average error of the sum of the three terms = 2.67 
average error of hue between red & green = 0.86 
----------- green & blue = 0.99 
----------- blue and red = 0.85 
If the errors in each of the three colours were independent of [text?] 
then the error of the sum would be the square root of the sq[uares] 
of the errors of each colour, that is, 1.76 Since the true 
is 2.67 it follows that the errors are not independent [text?] 
that they <s>[text?]<\s> generally are in the same direction in each [text?] 
Again if the errors in red and green were independent [text?] 
of (red-green) should be the same as that of (red+green) and 
should be 1.33 whereas that of red+green is 1.57 and that of 
(red-green) is only 0.86 showing that red and green vary to[gether?] 
and that a variation in hue between red and green is [not?] 
easily detected than a variation in brightness due to an [increase?] 
or diminution of both simultaneously. 
The errors in the determination of the other colours are 
.74 for red 1.55 for green and 1.34 for blue. <\s>
